White people criticising @DavidLammy for having a problem with the Comic Relief imagery of Stacey Dooley holding a black child is making me cringe inside out with shame. LISTEN. LEARN. FROM THOSE WHOSE VOICES MATTER MORE THAN YOURS IN THIS CASE.
Mr @davidlammy I'm pleased to say I not only didn't pledge any money to Comic Relief, I didn't even watch the show. Your praise for me would be welcome.

The backlash people like @DavidLammy get for speaking out about Comic Relief reminds me of when disabled people critique ‚Äòpity porn‚Äô fundraising. There‚Äôs a certain section of society that is deeply threatened by a minority group not being ‚Äògrateful‚Äô and stepping out our place.

Comic Relief is often the 1st image of the Continent children see in the UK. It makes them associate it with poverty, disease, no technology and orphans, as if that‚Äôs all there is. 
As a Black kid still learning myself, I was forced to educate others, which was beyond stressful.

text: Ok, wasn‚Äôt going to go there but there are a lot of people completely missing the point David Lammy is making. Here‚Äôs where I went from being that ‚Äòwhite saviour‚Äô to seeing it as deeply problematic.
